page.title: 16NEW ABBEY - RECREATION
page.content: The main summer game is bowling. The green,situated beside Sweetheart Abbey was opened in 1975 and has been very successful. The villagers are keen gardeners and vie with each other at the Annual Flower Show.The area is also favoured by fishermen where sea-trout,brown trout and young salmon can be hooked. Walking is popular and there are many lovely rambles around the village while for the more energetic a climb to the summit of Criffel is rewarding. There is a thriving football club which plays in all seasons whilst the badminton and carpet bowling clubs meet weekly. The Curling Club is popular though they have to travel to Lockerbie Ice Rink to Play. There is a curling pond behind Kindar House where a "Bonspiel" can be held in suitable weather.
